Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duchamp-Villon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have become good friends with a writer who wrote a very popular book about Mexico City. He invited us to stay with him in his large apartment in the Colonia Condessa, one of the most popular and architectually beautiful sections of Mexico City. We thanked him for the invitation, but we wanted a full week in Mexico City and felt that we would be imposing. We asked him to recommend a hotel near his apartment, and he immediately mentioned the Hotel Stanza, a place where he stayed as his apartment was being readied for his occupancy. Whenever we travel, I like to do as much research on the internet as possible before we go. We were really excited about going to Mexico City this year, our eighth trip in a row to Mexico. Mexico City, however, came with a caveat, and that was that you don't go to Mexico City to relax. It's an incredibly exciting and vibrant city, and with so much to see and do, we were always going to be on the go. Therefore, we needed a hotel to fit our needs, a clean, quiet place, centrally located and reasonably priced. The Hotel Stanza was the perfect hotel in all respects, and we're already planning a return visit. Located on the Avenida Alvaro Obregon in the Colonia Roma, it not only has a perfect location, right near a metro stop, metro buses and available cabs, it also has one of the best street markets I've ever seen right outside, on the Avenida Alvaro Obregon, and it's there every weekend. As for the hotel itself, the rooms were modern, tastefully decorated, cleaned every morning and the price we paid was amazingly low for a full seven night stay. My recommedation would be to ask for an inside room, one off the street, because you can get a lot of street noise if your room is facing the two streets that border the hotel. The hotel has a restaurant, internet, room service, an exercise room that we didn't use since we were walking so much, and then the real bonus, a separate room on the top floor with three irons and ironing boards. The hotel also has a laundry service, but the top draw for me was how incredibly warm and professional the staff was, eager to make your stay a memorable one. We showed up on the day we arrived in Mexico City, planning to take a bus to the beach that night for a week and then return, just to check on our reservation. We hadn't planned for the fact that we were totally exhausted and needed to rent a room for the day. It was early in the morning, and we had no reservation for that day, yet they told us it would be no problem to find us a room. They directed us to the hotel's cafe for breakfast, and midway through breakfast they came to our table to tell us that our room was ready for us. The staff who ran the hotel were simply wonderful. I can't say enough about the Hotel Stanza. It really was the perfect hotel for our trip, and I couldn't see staying anywhere else when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BeaMM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located not far from the subway station Cuauhtemoc. Our room was on Morelia street and it was quiet. The mattress was very hard so we put the extra blanket on it to provide more cushioning. The staff was friendly. We only ate breakfast once at the restaurant and thought it was mediocre. Nothing amazing but it was good for the price and it felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: bigdra
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly service and clean. A bit loud on the street side on the weekends, but generally a good stay at a good price. Can't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: mateotravels
Reviews.Content: Convenient and nice spot. Nothing out of the ordinary, relatively quiet (on higher floors at least), definitely good for the money ($640MXN for a double).

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms and location but cranky staff, watch out for hidden taxes”
Reviews.Author: vercautern
Reviews.Content: Every member of the staff in this hotel seemed in a bad mood, the rooms are great though and the area too. It's practical with the fast food restaurant in the building and it works well with room service. Decent wireless but they charge extra for use of computers, they charged me an extra 19% tax which I didn't notice at the website I booked through

Reviews.Title: “Return to the Hotel Stanza”
Reviews.Author: Don_Cuevas
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed at the Hotel Stanza before (see my previous review.) This time we chose it for its levels of comfort and pleasant and attractive location. I thought it only fair to now update my earlier report. The desk staff was very helpful, especially Cristina, who is very fluent in English. They helped me to locate a repair shop when the earpiece of my glasses fell off. We had drinks and a snack in the restaurant, and they were fine. I had my laptop with me and it connected without a problem everywhere I tried it, including the restaurant. The first room to which the bellman took us was not to our tastes; smaller, a strange layout and seemed somewhat unkempt. Most of all, it faced the park, and we'd requested a room facing the interior when I'd made our reservation. No problem. He called the desk and they immediately sent up keys to two other rooms, one of which was very satisfactory. As an earlier reviewer wrote, there was no longer any smoke problem in the lobby and restaurant. The room was spacious, the beds and pillows comfortable, the bath quite serviceable. We were so comfortable in that room and overall pleased with the hotel, we also booked it for our return from the U.S. 3 weeks later.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a fine attached restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: OnParleFrancais
Reviews.Content: This is a fine place to stay if you do business in the neighborhood. ThereÂ´s a local bus in front which I never took but will indeed drop you off at the Metrobus station on Avenida Insurgentes Sur, where I was taking a language course. ItÂ´s a little noisy at night, thanks to the scavengers going through the hotelÂ´s trash on the street outside at about 4 in the mornign. I moved after a few days to a hotel closer to the school. I liked the attached restaurant, very modern and brightly lit, where I could sit and do my homework. The food was good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, no-frills business hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: PrairieGirlGozGlobal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Stanza is in a great location with lots of restaurants close by. The staff is very professional, both friendly and efficient. The rooms are clean, have a good-sized desk, and free wireless. Rooms have safes for storing valuables (even my laptop fit). I visited in Feb. & opted for no air-con; by 9 am the room was getting warm. Fans are provided, as is a bar fridge. Bathroom is spacious but has no make-up/shaving mirror. The lobby is no longer smoky (new law) but my room faced the park and did smell of sewer every morning. Internet in the business centre is very slow. Would recommend for (business) travellers wanting a safe, basic, reasonably-priced hotel. Not suited for families w. small children. Restaurant is o.k. but only 2 blocks away is the wonderful Bisquets Obregon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice notel, but one smelly drawback”
Reviews.Author: morticia
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Parque Ensenada ( 3 nights) after reading the reviews here at Tripadvisor. The price was reasonable - 480 Peso pr. night with fan. They claim to be a eco-hotel, which is very good, but then the cleaninglady should not throw away the handsoap everyday. Otherwise a nice hotel with friendly staff, internett, Wings cafe, big rooms and bath, clean, good beds, cabel-tv, safe in the room and minibar, although we could not open it :-( The only problem was a terrible sewage smell that came and went, day and night (sometimes in the lobby, the elevator, and the room even when the window was closed). It was the worst smell ever. I'm not sure where it came from, but at the corner of the park besides the hotel the smell was constant and I could not even breath. I'm sorry to say, next time in Mexico city I will find another hotel, just because of the sewage smell.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Entire Family!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During our first stay at Parque Ensenada, we experienced such a great time. The hotel is conveniently located a couple of minutes away from historical sites. It's practically 10 minutes away from the Angel de la Independencia. The staff is just wonderful and polite, very courteous. To whoever wants a good hotel for a very REASONABLE price, Parque Ensenada will be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent value in its category. I stayed for a week in business and I enjoyed the hotel very much. Very clean, good size rooms, beautiful bathtroom and a very convenient location. Very helpful staff and the restaurant Wings good value and quality food and service. I would not hesitate to recommend it. I will use it as my hotel for future trips. I did have an executive single without A/C, but next time I will pay a little extra for the A/C, it is necessary for warm days and nights for us from the north. Not all rooms are air conditioned, although a big fan is provided. The electronic safe in the room very convenient, as is the mini bar, without the normally expensive prices. Enrique Schonfeldt

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Stanza
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Alvaro Obregon 13 | esq con Morelia, Col. Roma, Mexico City 06700, Mexico
